text: was a village located in Tomata District, Okayama Prefecture, Japan. As of 2003 (before the merger), the village had an estimated population of 817 and a density of 10.73 persons per km². The total area was 76.13 km². On March 1, 2005, Tomi, along with the town of Okutsu, and the village of Kamisaibara (all from Tomata District), was merged into the expanded town of Kagamino. Category:Dissolved municipalities of Okayama Prefecture
title: Tomi, Okayama
